title: Cannot use the plus sign(+) for whitespace control: tag name expected
body:
## Expected Behavior

Assuming `trim_blocks` is always `False`.

When `lstrip_blocks` is set to `True`, jinja should output
```html
<!-- 1 -->
    <!-- 2 -->
foo<!-- 3 -->
<!-- 4 -->
<!-- 5 -->
```

And when it's `False`, jinja should output
```html
    <!-- 1 -->
    <!-- 2 -->
    foo<!-- 3 -->
    <!-- 4 -->
    <!-- 5 -->
```

## Actual Behavior

In either case,

> jinja2.exceptions.TemplateSyntaxError: tag name expected

## Template Code
```jinja
    <!-- 1 -->
    {%+ if True %}<!-- 2 -->
    foo<!-- 3 -->
    {% endif %}<!-- 4 -->
    <!-- 5 -->
```

The following template also has a similar issue:

```jinja
    <!-- 1 -->
    {% if True %}<!-- 2 -->
    foo<!-- 3 -->
    {%+ endif %}<!-- 4 -->
    <!-- 5 -->
```

## Full Traceback

    response = self.handle_exception(e)

    reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)

    raise value

jinja2.exceptions.TemplateSyntaxError: tag name expected

## Your Environment
* Python version: 3.6.1+
* Jinja version: Jinja2==2.9.6
